blog.name: dherran
blog.title: Last Chance To Evacuate Planet Earth Before It Is Recycled
blog.description: Thomas. He/him. Mostly I just exist.

body:
Yasha’s tribe

I feel pretty confident that the horrible thing Yasha did was kill her own tribe in a fit of rage, probably influenced by the fiendish entity after Zuala’s death - we’ve seen no indication that the tribe still exists; she doesn’t remember the months after running away and wouldn’t know if they were gone; and during her flashback in e46, Matt mentions her standing in “a muddied field of burning huts and corpses”, which fits with the moorlands (her village?). “Loss can bring sorrow, bring hate, bring cruelty and darkness” - these are emotions of revenge, and who else would be her target?

It’s very interesting that people outside the tribe know of her (the fiendish entity, the drow, and the hobgoblin) - we haven’t heard a single mention of the tribe outside of Yasha herself, which could mean it’s a small, relatively insignificant tribe, or that it doesn’t exist anymore. It’s also interesting that she’s surprised these people have heard of her (at least that’s how i interpret her reaction).

It could very well be unrelated, but I think the pieces line up too well for it to be a coincidence

(Also I might just be late to the party and everyone already suspects this, but I haven’t really seen it mentioned)

Edit: I speculated she got her title from killing her own tribe, but she clearly got the name when she joined and took a blood oath (ep. 46)

body:
Mighty Nein: Treason what treason, we haven't commited any treason. 
Mighty Nein, exactly 5 minutes later: uuuuh so here's Empire's exact attack plan

blog.name: incarnation-of-rasputin
blog.title: A Far Green Country
blog.description: Lief | he/him/his | 24 | ace. History researcher / soon to be graduate student. If you have any questions about college or research or anything, I'd be happy to help! I'm trash for a lot of things, including but not limited to: Lord of the Rings, Critical Role, Boku No Hero Academia, Haikyuu!!, LGBT+ (including ace & aro) positivity, BBC Merlin, Dan and Phil content, memes, animals, and aesthetic nature shots.

tags: wow this post got really out of hand
also with the fjord counterspell i loved that travis asked Caleb for help with figuring out what his spellcasting modifier was
rather than asking for Liam's help lol
anywho the magic in this episode was bothering me and I wanted to think through it
i strongly think it's a disguise self spell since that's the simplest explanation
but it's weird that matt was paying such close attention to spell levels when cast on the drow
and i'm so hype to see what it is
summary: I wanted to think through the possibilities of this drow and why some spells worked and others didn’t. Spoilers for Campaign 2...
body:
I wanted to think through the possibilities of this drow and why some spells worked and others didn’t. Spoilers for Campaign 2 Episode 63 below!

In this episode, the party cast 5 spells on / relating to the drow:

1. Jester’s Dispel Magic on Nott

2. Fjord’s Counterspell on the drow, who was casting some sort of teleport spell.

3. Jester’s Locate Object on the Scarf the drow was wearing

4. Caduceus’ Locate Creature on the drow

5. Jester’s Sending on the drow

Jester casts Dispel Magic on Nott (to get rid of the Charm spell): DC of 14. She had to roll a D20 and add her Wisdom modifier, which means that the drow didn’t cast this as a spell with a level. This indicates to me that the charm spell was more of an innate spellcasting ability. In addition to this ability, the drow also had some sort of teleportation and possible disguise spells.

At 3:13 Fjord casts Counterspell (in a super clutch move) on the drow, to stop their teleportation attempt (which would have also taken the hobgoblin with them). Matt had to check something on his phone when Fjord did this, and had Fjord roll a spellcasting ability check (which is typical for Counterspell–however, this means that the teleport spell was higher than 3rd level, though all teleport spells are, so that doesn’t say much). I couldn’t glean anything else from this scene (so I’d appreciate others’ opinions!). Travis rolled a 20 so that also doesn’t help figure out what level the spell was, haha (but it was sick af).

At 3:45 Jester casts Locate Object on the scarf she saw. The dialogue (with some irrelevant things removed) was as follows: Matt: “Wait, what level was this?” Laura: “This is second level.” Matt: “oh…[insert more dialogue] strangely, it picks up nothing.” Laura: “it was a fucking disguise.” My attention was immediately drawn to Matt asking what level the spell was, which made me think Rakshasa, since they have spell immunity up to a certain level (Level 6, which doesn’t make sense with the next spell, so it’s definitely not a Rakshasa–at least with traditional stats), but Laura might very well be right (and I personally think she is for reasons further down).

At 3:54 Caduceus casts Locate Creature on the drow. The audio goes as follows: Matt [mumbling]: “locate creature… fourth level.” [reads more from his phone… continues reading for a prolonged amount of time–literally 25 seconds] “Okay, you do sense it.” And this is why I needed to make this post lol.

From the Locate Creature spell: “The spell can locate a specific creature known to you, or the nearest creature of a specific kind (such as a human or a unicorn), so long as you have seen such a creature up close - within 30 feet - at least once. If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the Effects of a Polymorph spell, this spell doesn’t locate the creature.”

Which means that the drow wasn’t “in a different form,” and yet Jester couldn’t sense the scarf. This springs to mind 2 options: 1) the drow has some sort of magical immunity, at least to a certain level–an idea partially influenced by Matt’s attention to spell levels during this fight; 2) the drow was under a Disguise Self spell, which influences appearance but does not change one’s form. That would explain why Locate Object didn’t work (cast on a scarf that wasn’t real) but Locate Creature did (cast on a creature whose form was not changed by a Disguise Self spell).

Jester later casts Sending, a 3rd level evocation spell. If we look at the possible spell immunity route, Locate Creature and Locate Object are both divination spells, so if the drow has immunity, it’s not an immunity to a specific type of magic. The Sending spell goes through, so maybe the drow is immune to spells up to level 2. However, I think the simplest explanation is that the drow was under the effects of a Disguise Self spell. I saw someone mention that the drow may have been a Cambion (sorry I can’t find your reply anymore :c ), but the Cambion has Alter Self as a daily spell, and the first line of that spell is “You assume a different form,” so the Locate Creature wouldn’t have gone through. Also the Cambion’s Plane Shift teleport ability applies explicitly only to itself, and the drow was going to teleport both themself and the hobgoblin, so the drow’s true form is unlikely to be a Cambion.

The only reason I’m including the thought that the drow might be immune to magic up to a certain level is because Matt kept asking about it, which was strange to me. It seems very unlikely as the explanation for this, but I think it’s important to note and keep in mind when trying to figure out what this drow’s business is.

Another confusing thing was that even though the drow wasn’t in the room when Jester came in as the British drow woman, they still knew who Jester was to the point that they stated it outright when she cast Sending. At no point did the drow see Jester outside of her Disguise Self spell (it’s not concentration, so it wouldn’t have gone away during the fight), so 1) he knew Jester as Jester the tiefling already or 2) he saw Jester as the drow woman fighting alongside the Mighty Nein and assumed she was with them–though Jester was never inside at the same time as him, so it’s unlikely that he would have seen her. Lots of unknowns!
body_abstract: I wanted to think through the possibilities of this drow and why some spells worked and others didn’t. Spoilers for Campaign 2 Episode 63 below!

tags: this is RI D I C U L O US
and i will not stand for it
i yell as i start episode 12 of critical role and read about all the different dice out there

blog.name: hazelcephalopod
blog.title: Another Side of the Mirror
blog.description:
This has mostly turned into a CR blog-thing... I tag Thursday show until around Tuesday.

Hello peoples of Tumblr! This is my blog, which I make no promise to keep up with. I'm a bisexual Autistic. Also have ADD. I like cephalopods, especially cuttlefish, and plants, and reading, and many other geeky things.

More random tidbit: feminist, somewhere in the left politically, and tired of the political landscape but still trying to care. Also a lapsed pagan, it sounds like nonsense but idk how else to describe it. More things- gluten free, and crochet, knitting, and others. Beware of my many random posts as well.

That is all for now!

Oh BTW I am bad at tagging things, trying to get better, but its a work in progress.

body:
CR, Jester’s Sending

Jester: “Eyes are on you. You have left the rendezvous. What happened to the mission?”

Mystery target: “I know you, but I appreciate the attempt at deception. If you are intent on following, come north… bring her.”
